intro: Gymnosporia salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, willow-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It has a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Gymnosporia salicifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
